answers.answer: I had many many CBCs going through anal cancer treatment.  The only reason I ever looked @ them was because my sis thought I should.  Frankly, I was too ill with chemo and radiation to care.  Figured the oncologists who ordered tests were handling that.I need to know more about what an HPV infection is.  No one talked to me about it...just blood counts: which were in ok range for patient in chemo treatmentAfter the worse was over the only tests were something they do before CTscans.I just went to MD Anderson for pelvic..which has to be done with a wee speculum, as radiation has scarred vagina, anus and uretha.  Results were 'stable'.Don't know if any of this has helped you.  Be very aggressive with doc.  I wasn't and didn't get the best of treatment.  Almost died from c dif, because they misdiagnosed stuff and disagreed on treament plan..lol.

question: Has anyone had routine CBC blood tests done while they had an active HPV (High Risk) infection accompanied with abnormal paps?I ask this because up until October of this year I have had clean paps for the last 10 years.  I see an edocrinologist regularly because 2 years ago a pituitary tumor was found.  This resulted in LOTS of blood work every 2 - 3 months.  I also have Hashimotos Thyroid, Diabetes and Vitamin D deficiancy.  For a year and a half my White Blood Cells have been high... specifically my Neutrophils and Segs have been abnormally high and my Lymphocytes have been low.  As I said before it's been like this consistantly (sometimes increasing further) for the last year and a half  and checked every 2 or 3 months.Could the HPV or abnormal cell changes be the cause of this? Has anyone else had this experience?
title: CBC panel
